Package cs12b.mySQL_PA

Class DatabaseBackup

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs12b.mySQL_PA.DatabaseBackup

  • public class DatabaseBackup
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a data structure that allows you to back up databases. You can back up a maximum of 3 databases. The underlying data structure is a doubly linked list based stack.

    You should not edit this class. However, feel free to study its implementation.

    Version:
    2.0 COSI 12B: MySQL PA 11/15/2019
    Author:
    Chami Lamelas

      Number of Databases that have been currently backed up

      Tail of the underlying DLL-based stack.

    • Field Detail

      • LIMIT

        private static final int LIMIT
        Maximum number of databases that can be backed up
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • head

        private DatabaseBackup.Node head
        Head of the underlying DLL-based stack. This will store the oldest backup.

      • tail

        private DatabaseBackup.Node tail
        Tail of the underlying DLL-based stack. This will store the newest backup.

      • numDbs

        private int numDbs
        Number of Databases that have been currently backed up

    • Constructor Detail

      • DatabaseBackup

        public DatabaseBackup​()
        Initializes a database backup structure.

    • Method Detail

      • backUp

        public void backUp​(Database db)
        Backs up a database in the structure. If it exceeds the maximum capacity it will delete the oldest backup automatically.
        Parameters:
        db - a database to back up

      • getLatestBackUp

        public Database getLatestBackUp​()
        Gets the most recent backup from the structure and removes it. This means between 0 and 2 Databases remain backed up.
        Returns:
        the latest backup

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty​()
        Checks if the database structure has any more databases backed up.
        Returns:
        if there are no dbs backed up
